### Literature review

Here is the R package I briefly mentioned about literature reviews, it is truly excellent (although it does not necessarily makes things quicker in the end, as you just end up going deeper in the findings/complexity)
https://elizagrames.github.io/litsearchr/

and associated (very well documented) vignettes/tutorials
https://luketudge.github.io/litsearchr-tutorial/litsearchr_tutorial.html
https://elizagrames.github.io/litsearchr/litsearchr_vignette.html
https://elizagrames.github.io/litsearchr/introduction_vignette_v010.html

It belongs to the metaverse ecosystem, of which goal is to collect, integrate and expand the universe of available functions for evidence synthesis generation (i.e., the process of identifying, collating and synthesising primary scientific research such as articles and reports for the purposes of providing reliable, transparent summaries).

https://rmetaverse.github.io/
